Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot camera for pet lovers!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Lowe
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera last week and I love it.  I have a large zoom digital camera (Panasonic Lumix) for wild life photos on vacation.  But I wanted a small point and shoot to take mostly inside photos of my dog, in low light.  I have a Sony Cybershot DSC-W50 that takes great outside photos, but horrible, blurry inside photos.  I found that unless my dog sat completely still, every photo blurred.  Not with my new Fuji.  I've taken at least 300 photos in the last 5 days and they're terrific.  I mostly use the Anti-blur setting with a red eye reduction flash for my dog, and I haven't been disappointed.  I also looked at the Canons, but found them to be slow in writing speed and flash recycle time.  I considered the Fuji F40d or F50d at $250, but the flash recycle time was very slow on the F50d, which is the newer version.  For $150, I have a great camera that does exactly what I want it to.  Great battery life considering how much I've been playing with it in the last week.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: FOR THE PRICE, ITS A PERFECT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Navarro
Reviews.Content: i just bought this camera. the picture quality is excellent. the video quality isnt as great and i have seen better, but on a $300 camera. but it does the job.the pictures are extremely clear. day or night.for the price, i highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value.  Takes good pictures.
Reviews.Author: D. Hentze
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for wife so she would have small camera to carry around with her on vacation. While the pictures it takes will never be mistaken for pics taken with a DSLR, the results are generally very good. It's also very simple to use. If you're the type of person that is going to "pixel peep", or be upset about "noise" at a high ISO, then this probably isn't the camera for you. Then again, no camera for around $100 is going to make you happy. If you want an inexpensive, small camera to just take pictures, then this camera is an excellent choice. It's a small, no-frills, to the point, point and shoot. It also seems very well built, and the 2.5" screen is acceptable for a camera at this price. The camera itself probably rates about 4 stars, but I give it 5 stars at its price point.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera clear pictures on the move
Reviews.Author: John A. Flores
Reviews.Content: I was pretty impressed with this camera from the start, its got a pretty small design so it wont get in the way. The quality of the pictures are really good, and the camera does a good job of determining lighting conditions for the auto flash. One of the best features of the camera is its ability to take clear shots of moving objects, I've taken pictures of people moving as well as taken shots from cars on the road and the picture remains clear with little or no blurring. Great camera for the price I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a 8.2 mp digital camera thats light and portable but takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for an Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: G. James
Reviews.Content: I just recently purchased this camera, and I am absolutely in love with it. I was actually thinking about purchasing a Nikon camera, because a friend recommended that brand to me. But when I saw how much they cost, I decided to look around some more. Well, I accidently came across this camera, and after reading all of the wonderful reviews and doing some research I decided to go ahead and buy it.Well let me tell you, I absolutely love this camera. It does everything, you could want a camera to do, and so much more. The pictures come out so clear and the camera is very compact and light; and it took me less than 5 minutes to learn how to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicole
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a recent vacation and found it to be an excellent choice. The Finepix is an easy to use point and shoot camera.The pictures it takes are very clear - this is probably a result of Fujifilm's Picture Stabilization Technology. I took pictures from a moving bus, and they look as if I'm standing still.The camera is good in low light at a reasonable distance. We took pictures of the Las Vegas Strip at night, and they look amazing. However, we also took pictures in a very dim room and found that unless the object you were focusing on was close at hand, it was very difficult to see in the picture. The low light pictures still very clear.The 3X zoom was perfect for every picture that I wanted to take and made items look close enough for a good shot.In sum, this is an excellent purchase for the price. I recommend this camera to anyone wanting to take basic, good pictures.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera
Reviews.Author: M. Ryan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera with basic functions. Really if my Samsung Blackjack's camera has a built in flash, I might not really need a new camera. I need a small camera that can fit in my purse or pants pockets. I looked at some models that use rechargable AA batteries, but the camera will be a lot thicker and heavier. This camera fits my requirements and the price is really attractive.I played with it the night I received it. The basic manual didn't take too long to read through the important points. There is supposed to be a more detailed manual in the CD, but I haven't had the need to read it yet.The anti-blur feature, which is new to me, is really useful. The camera doesn't have too many buttons to confuse me, and as you change the settings the explanation of the new setting is displayed on the LCD. No need to keep the manual around with you.I have a 1GB Kingston micro SD that I bought for my cell phone, and I am able to use it on this camera, with the SD adaptor. The basic manual does warn that some mini/micro SD adaptors have additional contacts at the back and they should not be used on this camera.Overall I am really pleased with the features on this camera. I look forward to bringing it with me on my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: For the money, this is a great camera.The menu and user interface are very simple. The camera is quick during power up and with recycling after photos.The image stabilization seems to help. I lose fewer pictures than with the Canon SD1000 that I had prior.  I miss the viewfinder of the Canon SD1000, but this is quickly disappearing as a feature anyway.The screen has been plenty bright for my use.The included Lithium ion battery gives better life than AAs and is lighter.I would recommend as a great starter camera or as a tote along compact that you don't want to sink a lot of money into.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Novak
Reviews.Content: Absolutely unbelievable!  This camera is great.  I have had some bad experiences with Nikons in the past and for my first Fujifilm I was supremely impressed.  The shots are enormous and can be really crisp and clear.  It's not as fancy but there are lots of settings and helpful features that get the job done right.Be careful to set the camera to the proper camera mode before going into a situation such as a wedding or graduation.  I missed my brother getting his diploma because I had to change the setting last minute (But we have it on film camera and video camera)

Reviews.Title: Impressive little digital camera
Reviews.Author: S. K. "S.K."
Reviews.Content: I had lot of doubts before buying this product. However after taking pictures and using this camera I found out that this is an impressive litlle pocket camera. I would recommend this product to everyone who wants to get crisp  and beautiful pictures. It has very useful and easy to operate software. Excellent product.

Reviews.Title: A No Brainer...
Reviews.Author: chris s
Reviews.Content: Great looking camera, takes great pictures without all the bells and whistles I didnt want. Uncomplicated and easy

Reviews.Title: Good price for basic camera
Reviews.Author: The Fred "iamthefred"
Reviews.Content: I've purchased several digital Fuji cameras over the years and have been very happy with them. I purchased this one because of its very small size (and low cost). After comparing this one to similar cameras by other manufacturers, I decided to stick with Fuji. Like all others in this size and price range, it lacks a viewfinder (which I sorely miss), but that's just the way they are making them nowadays.I found a couple of the controls to be slightly funky, but nothing I couldn't easily adjust to. Most other aspects of the camera functioned pretty much as I expected -- time between pictures, light adjustments, etc. The one critisism I have is that the colors are not as vibrant as in photos I've taken with my other Fuji digital cameras (which used the super CCD technology). On the other hand, I paid between $350 and $550 for my previous cameras, so the comparison really isn't valid.All in all, a nice, small camera that will comfortably fit in a shirt pocket. Great for taking on an outing where you don't want to lug around a heavy camera and just want to take some casual snapshots.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle L. Mcghee
Reviews.Content: I like the compact size of the camera, and the picture quality is great.  There aren't many features on this camera, but the simplicity is actually nice.  I am very pleased with this camera for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Photo Princess
Reviews.Content: This camera packs a lot in a tiny package.  The images are crisp and clear, it's quick and easy to learn the functions (takes 10 minutes or less), and it's as small and lighter than my cell phone.  Great for a second camera too.JoHouston

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: I'm going on a trip to Europe and needed a new camera. I wanted a simple camera that takes great pictures and has long battery life. My new Fuji is all of this. You can figure out how to work it straight out of the box without needing to look at a manual. All the features are great, the pictures look nice. The battery is easy to charge and lasts quite a while. I would definitely recommend this camera for anyone who needs a high-quality, simple camera. Plus, you can't beat the price.

Reviews.Title: Very nice little camera
Reviews.Author: B. Guttman
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting a small, economical point/click camera that takes good pictures with the minimum ammount of blur.  That's exactly what I got.  Camera is easy to use, very intuitive and has an unusually long battery life (I've been able to use it daily for about 4-5 weeks between charges).  The pictures are sharp, I've been able to take beautiful action photos without hand or motion blur.  For a basic camera without any frills, bells or whistles I deffinately recommend it.  It's small and light enough to keep in my purse on a daily basis.My one qualm is that the software it came with sucks.  It won't work properly on my new computer (and I don't have an old PC to test it on) and crashes when I try to upload photos from the camera.  My PC does have a memory slot reader so I've been able to get around the problem without difficulty, but if the software and cabling are key for you, you might want to look into an alternative.

Reviews.Title: New to Digital Cameras
Reviews.Author: Evonne Atterton
Reviews.Content: [[ASIN:B0011ZK6ZC Fujifilm Finepix J10 8.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Brushed Silver)This is our first and came with a nice thick book for use.  We struggled to get the memorey card installed and had a younger family member do that for us.  We love it and are having fun transferring pics to the computer to share with our kids & grandchildren. This little camera takes beautiful pictures and the display is large enough for anyone to see.  It is very small and fits into your shirt pocket.  LOVE IT... AND THE PRICE IS RIGHT

Reviews.Title: very pleased!!
Reviews.Author: Ashley Rigby "Miss. Rigby"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for personal use. Although I'm not a professional photographer I greatly enjoy taking pictures and this camera has suited me well. It's because of its generally high reveiws that I chose this camera out of the many to choose from, and I add my two thumbs up to it! The picture resolution is so clear and amazing and the "movie" recording works fantastically. Another thing that has pleased me is the way it captures in real color instead of giving it that "picture" look. For a camera of its price I am thoroughly satisfied. :)

Reviews.Title: The best for the bucks
Reviews.Author: A. Burton
Reviews.Content: This ia a jewel. Fuji makes great digital cameras that are within anyone's budget. I would recommend the Fuji J10 to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Battery is not $50
Reviews.Author: jbat "jbat"
Reviews.Content: Nice point and shoot camera.  Price is good. A great starter camera or use as a spare.  I have had problems with cameras in this price range with premature death under 2 years - Pentax, Samsung.  I don't expect this one to last long either.  My $600 + digital cameras have preformed without premature death, but they are bigger to carry - this one is so convenient.  The battery price is not $50 - check around. I purchased one for under $12 with free shipping.

Reviews.Title: Nice DC
Reviews.Author: Boying Zhang
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal user of Fuji series, now I need a slim one, and J10 is just my target.

Reviews.Title: Ok not worth more than $90
Reviews.Author: Kinger7102
Reviews.Content: Pros:inexpensive (I paid $90) - I would say it's worth it at $90 but not much more.small - fits in my pocket without being uncomfortable.easy to useGood pictures in good lightBattery - charges quickly lasts a whileCons:Horrible night photosFlash bleaches the colorblurry photos in lower light or without flashAll in all this is an ok camera. I wasn't expecting anything amazing, but I thought it may perform slightly better at night. Since I'll primarily be using it for hiking (i.e. the daytime), I'm not too worried. Knowing what I know now I may have spent an extra $30-$50 for something better under non ideal lighting conditions, but this will do until I break it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Lindsey M. West
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a present for my Boyfriend and it was perfect! It looks cool, the pictures are great, it is easy to use with our computer and the rechargeable battery really lasts. We are just casual photographers, taking pictures mostly of our friends and trips but we are totally happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: The perfect amount of features
Reviews.Author: J. Mills
Reviews.Content: I have had the Fuji Finepix J10 for about a week now. I take a lot of car and beach pics but I am an amateur. The menu system is easy to use and has just about the perfect amount of features for me. I see a lot of complaints about limited features but hey, it's a $100 point and shoot camera. Professionals would never be using it anyway. The people that would be using it are most likely people just like me. The camera is easy to understand and the pics are of excellent quality. My last camera was a Vivitar and the one before that was a Cannon. Both were highly featured and incredibly complex to use for even basic photography. The pics werent any better even when taken by friends that are knowledgable about photography. Plus I never used 90% of the features anyway. They were just in the way. I recommend the Fuji Finepix J10 highly for non professionals like myself that want a solid point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: fujifilm camera
Reviews.Author: Gabriel H. Gaston
Reviews.Content: The camera is being very useful for recording memories. The pictures are very sharp and the colors are bright.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: really a great little camera. especially for the price i don't think you can find a better camera out there.

Reviews.Title: fuji, japan
Reviews.Author: W. Y. Yang "yalee2"
Reviews.Content: it is such a joy to use this fantastic product.  easy to use, fun to shoot, and stylish to boot, this is one solid camera from one of the most trusted japanese manufactures.  amen to fuji!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: J. McMillen
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm J10 is a great little camera! It doesn't have a lot of buttons or switches to mess with. The anti jiggle thing works great too!We are happy we got this camera and think you will be too!

Reviews.Title: Great camera...
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Takes great photos.  Very clear -- no more fuzzy pictures due to the image stabilization.  Love it!!  Great price, too!

Reviews.Title: Great camera at great value.
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: I used the camera on a cruise, and the pictures I took outside on the ship, on the beach, and inside were all very clear and sharp.  I took a little getting used to the controls at first, but switching from mode to mode actually turned out to be a very useful control.  When traveling, the wall battery charger is very convinient to use b/c it doesn't require an extra power cord to carry like my other camera.

Reviews.Title: too many blurry shots
Reviews.Author: Geodon
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for my birthday in September. This was to replace an 8 year old Olympus digital camera. I wanted to preserve all those precious moments that my two young children will give to me.I have used it countless times and taken hundreds of pictures. I find that still shots come out beautiful but anything else and you run the risk of the shot being blurred. I have checked the troubleshooting section in the manual but nothing there has helped to resolve this issue. I have taken pictures with different settings and while some seem to work a bit better than others, many shots still end up on the blurry side. Others have stated that they find this camera to be great at taking shots on the move, I find this not to be the case with my particular camera. I do not know if it's a defect in the one I own or this particular line.This camera also came with an accessory pack. A charger, battery, tripod, carrying case, 4 GB memory card and cleaning kit.I would recomend saving your money and purchasing a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Karen Barrett
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera and priced just right. I love to take pictures  for fun- so i'm no professional here, but I must say, it captures the images perfectly even when my hand isn't perfectly still or if i haven't focused properly. I still get a great picture. A great buy!

Reviews.Title: nice pictures easy to use
Reviews.Author: Lisa M. Gardiner "gramma lisa"
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera takes very clear pictures not to many extra features to cunfuse me its great

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: T-Dog
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera - and took it out for a spin this last weekend.  I live in San Diego - so I went to Shelter Island and Harbor Island & took some fantastic pics!  I posted them in the customer images for the camera.  Check it out.  This camera will allow you to take your own postcards!

Reviews.Title: Excelent
Reviews.Author: Ricardo A. Santos
Reviews.Content: Excelent product...Easy to handle and the pictures are great...I recommend it to everybody!

Reviews.Title: Glad I picked this one
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Westfall
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to get shots of my 7 month old.  I was concerned about getting non-blurry shots since children move suddenly.  I've gotten great pictures of him.  We went to a parade and there was no blurring of the moving people or floats.  We even went to a Medeivel fair and had only slight blurring of joisting.  Not bad for two horses moving quickly in opposite directions.  The video function was handy.  I was able to capture my son's first steps even though I didn't have my video recorder with me because of this function, it even captured the sound.  The battery lasts quite well on a single charge and the camera is fairly intuitive in how it functions, I didn't have to read the manual to figure it out.  Small enough that I can alway have it with me.  Resolution is great, I'm very satisfied with my purchase, it does what I wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: took it to peru
Reviews.Author: Don Smith "DONTIPUP"
Reviews.Content: my wife took it to peru and all the pictures came out prefect. close shots and far away.the price is {right}.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, amazing photos
Reviews.Author: Mamasita "MelP"
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this camera. I am over the moon happy with it. It's ridiculously easy to use. You can touch up and crop photos, right in the camera! It has great settings, including picture stabilization for taking pictures of fast moving objects like little kids! The photos come out so wonderfully bright. Even the night photos look amazing! I love it so much!!!!

Reviews.Title: Finepix Camera
Reviews.Author: Sally M
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price.  Takes beautiful, clear pics, and truly easy to use.

Reviews.Title: The good easily outweighs the bad. Great walkingaround cam.
Reviews.Author: inohuri "inohuri"
Reviews.Content: A lot is wrong with this camera except the image quality which is wonderful.There is about half as much noise at the same ISO as my Canon point and shoots which is amazing. I wonder if Fuji can't say how good it is because it might be better than their upmarket cameras that are supposed to be low noise. Adequate for some sunsets, that's one of the major reasons I love it. The lens might not have much telephoto but that made it easy to manufacture a very good lens.Variable shutter to 8 seconds in fireworks mode. Usable night mode with a tripod. ISO 64 to 1600 in "manual".Excellent color.I bought two as my observation is that when a camera this good comes along it is quickly superseded with something worse. This also gave me a spare battery.To return to shoot mode press the shutter. This is really the best way to do it but they could have programmed both ways instead of the stupid message.The software didn't do much except stop my card reader from working (Win 2K). At least it uninstalled neatly and now I use the reader.The menus are in seemingly random order but include useful functions.The corners are cut off at full wide. Big deal, with 8 megapixels there is plenty to crop out. Typical for little cameras.The battery seems to run down over a few weeks if left in the camera. Best not to store the camera with the battery installed and carry a spare.If the LCD screen has a vertical line through it when there is a bright light such as the sun it won't be on the picture, go ahead and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Fuji J-10 review
Reviews.Author: S. Nelson
Reviews.Content: Fuji film 8mp J-10 camera. I had trouble choosing this camera over a samsung 860. But I got a J-10 for a good price. Along with that , I already had some XD cards from my not working so good fuji A350. So at least I didn't need to buy SD cards. This zoom is alittle jittery over the samsung 860, but not by much. So I try not to use zoom if I can help it.It takes great out-door pictues, but not as good INDOORS or longer distance indoors. I was never sure if it looked better with or without flash and somtimes get blurry without flash due to it probalby holding the shutter open longer without flash. All depends on distance and lighting indoors. I was getting used to using my wifes camera,, a sony cybershot DSCH-10 which took much better pics indoors. But it is a double the cost camera. I like that it also takes regular SD or XD cards, but manual says the video may be jumpy on the SD cards depending?? The olympus version of this says it takes Micro SD, not the full size sd,and you would need that stupid adapter thing, but don't quote me on that. I also was looking for a cam that took AA batteries due to availability, but once you get a few ion battery packs, you should be set. Batt life was acceptable, but factory batteries are $$$. I got a couple maximal power's off ebay cheap, and they seem to be ok, though may not last as long as original. Im very leary on no name batteries, but for $7-$14 for Two,, I can't complain. I wish it had a 5mp setting. It looks like it goes from 4mp to 8 and 8.2.  Over-all, im happy with the camera for a lower cost or backup/ something small camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT Camera
Reviews.Author: P. Kong "Seth"
Reviews.Content: I just received mine today. So far it's doing an outstanding job. Better than I expected actually. I noticed after taking pictures I try zooming in to see the details on an object and to my surprised..very detailed. Well worth the money. BUY IT. Easy to use, easy setup..etc. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: It broke within a month
Reviews.Author: Gadget Guy
Reviews.Content: I read the features. I even enjoyed the camera while I had it.  It failed within the first month.  The lens would not extend.It may have been an anomaly that it failed but I don't find it worth the risk of getting another Fuji J10.  It might fail after two months and I won't be able to return it to amazon.com at their postage cost...

Reviews.Title: Couldn't ask for more
Reviews.Author: P. Barber "PB"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my wife to replace her ailing Nikon Coolpix camera she has had for the last 2 years. Not only is it more powerful but the battery lasts a long time and the picture quality is great! She also mentioned that it's much easier to use and the flash doesn't take as long so your pictures are taken faster.

Reviews.Title: Good camera at a good price
Reviews.Author: Lina Jiordano "Big Mamma"
Reviews.Content: It's a great starter camera. I got it for my son for christmas and he loves it. It is very easy to use and has a big LCD screen. It takes really good pix too with hardly no delay time. I would recommend this camera for anyone especially young adults who love to take pix.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: PJ
Reviews.Content: I picked this up on a salesperson's recommendation and found a great price on Amazon.  It is easy to use and takes great pics for a snap and shoot.  To download the pictures I just connect the camera to my computer and use the standard Microsoft software that pops up.  The included software is not really needed.

Reviews.Title: fujifilm
Reviews.Author: Santiago Herrera Soasti
Reviews.Content: Small camera, the only negative thing is that the screen edge shouldn't be out of the camera, it should be flat.But the camera it's still ok...

Reviews.Title: Awsome
Reviews.Author: J. Gilliam "mr.k-otic"
Reviews.Content: this is good and it takes nice pics. good for people on a low budget. video capture is nice too

Reviews.Title: great pictures...tiny camera easily goes everywhere
Reviews.Author: E. CLAUS "not happy"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 15 yr old daughter. She loves it..it takes great pictures (very crisp and clear images) it's small enough to fit in a pocket or small purse. and very user friendly

Reviews.Title: small and fast, but bad movies and macro
Reviews.Author: A. Cook
Reviews.Content: small size and good pic quality make this a decent camera for family use.deal Breakers:MOVIES have terrible sound.  constant mechanism noise and audio recording is very quiet. other reviewers had similar problems. also, you cannot adjust zoom while filming; have to stop, zoom, startMACRO mode is a joke.  don't even try to take product photos with this camera!  i was spoiled by my old fuji S5500 (lost) which took AMAZING "super macro" shotsSweeteners:Very fast power-on time and good speed between shots (roughly 1.5 seconds)particularly great "sports" mode. with flash, sports mode cannot capture motion blur no matter how hard you try!  a dozen or so other modes such as "baby" "museum" "beach" "fireworks" etc. are kind of fun but haven't seen much actual use.

Reviews.Title: LCD Display way too dark for outdoors use
Reviews.Author: C. Weir
Reviews.Content: All the positive points cited by other reviewers are true.  Lightweight, easy to use point and shoot.  I found it fine for indoors use.  But outside, the LCD display was so dark all I could see was my own reflection.  No way I knew what I was shooting.  So, regretfully, I am returning what is otherwise a good little camera, and I will stick to my (much heavier) Canon powershot with viewfinder  -  even without the viewfinder, the display on the Canon shows up better in daylight than does the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Great easy camera to use
Reviews.Author: L. heatwole
Reviews.Content: We had this same one before and wanted another one.  It is perfect and very easy to use.  It also takes excellent pictures.

Reviews.Title: Not like an iPhone camera! Bad for up close!
Reviews.Author: Truthful Critique
Reviews.Content: I bought this so I could have a camera with the same megapixels as my iPhone 4s... thinking I could get the same quality photos (similar was my lowest expectation/hope), without carrying my valuable phone with me when I go to a third world country this week where I will be doing some research and need a camera to take detailed pictures of data I collect (fairly close up shots).I was wrong. This is an 8.2 megapixel camera, but it is NOTHING in comparison to my phone. I should have known better. The pictures are very poor quality, I'm disappointed it's too late for me to order a different camera before I leave on my trip. I might pull out my old digital 2.5 megapixel camera from High School photo class to use instead. The quality will look the same overall but there will be more features, as well as less blurry pictures!!!Cons:-Noisy - camera beeps on every photo, no option to turn this sound off (not to mention all the gears grinding makes it feel like I went stone age)-Image stabilization is extremely poor, meaning you have to have tripod-like (not human) hands if you want a semi-crisp picture (even bracing my arms against myself, I was unable to take an appreciably clear photo)-Images do not look like 8.2 megapixels (apparently I'll have to research megapixels because I learned today that they are not universal)-Camera struggles to focus at all distances but very close up, but if too close up all focus is lost again. Examples: at anything closer than 6 inches away, there was no focus ability, at distances of 12+ inches, focus quality increased. My advice for close shots is to go between 12-18 inches away, then zoom in to the image you want a picture of and hope it's close enough to get the details wanted.Pros:-Great for someone's FIRST EVER camera-Cheap-Lightweight/compact-Big LCD-Battery charger is compact and charges battery quicklyIf you are buying this as a go-to for decent quality pictures and a good price, I DO NOT recommend this. Or if you're a pampered iPhone owner (reluctantly admitted, I just discovered I am), then I don't think you will appreciate this camera. Thanks for reading and happy camera hunting!!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Marsha S. Smith "poodles"
Reviews.Content: Received it fast, was just as advertised. Great camera, it was wrapped well so there was no damage to it. Also the pictures it takes are great.

Reviews.Title: Good camera when used.
Reviews.Author: Charlene
Reviews.Content: Used a lot at first but am not a good "picture taker" and it's been lying in drawer for 2-3 years now.

Reviews.Title: Last a long time
Reviews.Author: Chris Vaughns
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife years ago and she still has it.  No problems whatsoever.  It even takes some nice pics.

Reviews.Title: Colors okay, pictures turn out pretty good
Reviews.Author: Sweet Concorde
Reviews.Content: The quality is good for the price. I was not fond of the menu, but the pictures turned out pretty well most of the time.I had mine for a couple years. I got it while my regular camera - a Canon A95 - was getting repaired (can't miss a month of baby pictures).I liked the small size - similar to a deck of cards. I ended up dropping it on my porch while the lens was out, and that's what killed it. My fault. It took pretty good pictures. I always had to use the flash (unless it was outdoors on a very bright day). I was happy with most of the pictures it took - the colors were not entirely accurate, all of them were "warm" but they weren't washed out and they weren't blurry (so long as I used the flash). I have a Canon PowerShot SX20IS and a Canon PowerShot A2200 - and, on the fly, this camera takes much better pictures than either of them. (With a lot of set up, the SX20IS takes much better pictures, but the auto mode is junky - it cost 3x the J10).The similarly priced A2200 takes abysmal pictures. I REALLY regret breaking my J10.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: J. Den
Reviews.Content: Really nice point and shoot for the money, just a shame I had to buy it for an ex-girlfriend. Guess I'm not getting that one back.

Reviews.Title: Sometimes good, sometimes horrible.  Not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: LDavis
Reviews.Content: If you are the type of person who just wants to take casual pictures of places you've been, moments with family, or just some spontaneous snapshots, this camera may suit you.  The construction and format is very straightforward.  The picture quality can be very good, and what I have found particularly satisfying is the camera's ability to capture movement (I noticed this when viewing pictures of moving water), the quality of its tones and detail, its ability to take excellent close-ups, and its balance in modest amounts of light.  I found that some pictures, compared to my Fujifilm Finepix JV100, appeared better than they would have if they were taken with the previous camera, which had recently broken.  The LCD screen is also satisfactory, and makes the pictures very visible.That being said (and here's where the person who considers him/herself artsy, the amateur photographer, the person who travels, the person who visits the outdoors, or the person who cares about quality may want to pay attention), the camera can take just awful pictures in a number of circumstances.  Want to zoom in?  Out of focus and extremely blurry, many, many times.  Taking a picture in a frame that is relatively monochromatic?  Colors are totally off.  Taking a picture toward a light source, toward the sky, or toward a significantly brighter area?  The camera can't handle it, complete overexposure.  Too much shade, too dark, approaching night, or cloudy and/or no direct light source?  Grainy, horrible pictures, unequivocally -- and this is the most significant flaw.  On top of that, it is almost completely impossible to operate the camera with any customized or manual features.  The entire camera body has only eleven buttons, and there are barely even any *automatic* features that you can set for varying conditions.  Virtually all you can do is point and shoot, meaning you have absolutely no control on how the pictures turn out.  There is no viewfinder, either, and the battery does not last long at all for the simplicity of the construction -- maybe 200 pictures.  Also considering the camera uses only 8.2 megapixels, you have very little ability to blow up any pictures that do turn out well; when I watched a few slide shows of some pictures on my laptop, almost every single one was low resolution and bad quality.  I would look elsewhere for a camera, especially considering this one is also becoming rapidly outdated.

Reviews.Title: good spare "beater" cam for the $
Reviews.Author: Phrancis
Reviews.Content: While I've seen some pretty bad reviews concerning mechanical issues, I've had mine for 3 years with heavy use with perfect functionality. It's been dropped, left in a hot broiling car, and even used underwater (in a waterproof camera case). It was bought for $90 as a spare simple to use point-n-shoot that was also easy to transport. Consequently it's actually gotten more use that our big complicated DSLR because of it's ease and portability. No, the pictures aren't as good, but they are darn nice for such a cheap digi-cam and sometimes on vacation you just don't want to deal with a bulky camera. The UI is easy enough, the optical zoom is ok for it's size/price, and the Li-ion battery life is pretty good. While I can't vouch for all the other reviewer's mechanical issues, I can say that I'm very impressed with the value I've gotten from this camera and I'm always one to heavily research/scrutinize any major consumer purchase...

Reviews.Title: perfect camera for the non professional
Reviews.Author: rybo
Reviews.Content: This is by FAR the best camera I've owned.  I'm a college student, and portability is important to me.  This camera is very thin and light.  The autofocus and camera modes are much, much better than my current Nikon (I dropped my Finepix and broke it...had to have a camera fast and they only had Nikon).  The camera was very reliable for me for a few years, was easy to take pictures with and light in my pocket.  If you're looking for an inexpensive camera that's reliable and takes good pictures, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: OrangeFan
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of years now and carry it in my pocket pretty much everywhere I go. Takes pretty good pics, decent battery life, and has given me only 1 problem since I've owned it - sometimes (rarely) the lens gets partially extended in my pocket and stays open (probably jostled it while in my pocket). It's usually just a matter of removing the battery and replacing it to get it to reset.Bottom line - It's a nice handy go-anywhere camera.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Finepix J10 is fun, small and easy!
Reviews.Author: D. Brinkley
Reviews.Content: The Fuji Finepix J10 is a decent camera.  It's not the best nor the worst but I am satisfied enough.  It's not worth top dollar but if you can find a used one like I did for [...] bucks and in mint condition, then you got a great deal!  I love the tiny size and the quick start up.  Video quality is not good but..it's not a camcorder.I got lucky finding my J10 for the 40 dollar price and getting it looking brand spanking new!  I thought for sure I was going to get one that was beat up OR mistreated. I decided that I don't want to buy new point and shoot cameras any more.  I get disapointed with point and shoots and wind up spending top dollar for brand new and for nothing.  Waste of money buying new unless it's a DSLR!Picture quality is average or decent and I am satisfied with that. The functions are easy and it's so nice and small anyone would love it.  It's a clean looking camera..nice and simple and fun.Find one at a refurbished price or a good used one and you will be happier with yourself! I think most folks will like this one. I have enjoyed it so far and I've only had it for two days.REMEMBER...DO NOT BUY POINT AND SHOOT CAMERAS BRAND NEW!  FIND BETTER DEALS WITH REFURBISHED OR GOOD USED ONES!

Reviews.Title: Good pics, but I HATE the battery.
Reviews.Author: critters
Reviews.Content: The battery is some special flat model that takes, like, 10 minutes to charge. "Great," you say? Not hardly, because that's about how long it lasts, and, unlike my previous Fuji, which used AAs, there's no way that I know of to have another set of batteries charged and ready to go. Hence, the battery's ALWAYS dead, and is so as I type. I find this VERY poor indeed; this thing needs more charging than my cell phone, which is on 24/7. Considering the battery to be a "feature," that's why I gave "features" 1 star. I'm seriously unhappy with this camera since it's useless without power. I'd appreciate a bigger camera with bigger batteries that's a lot more useful in the end.

Reviews.Title: nice camera - brilliant color
Reviews.Author: Debra Thornton
Reviews.Content: My old digital camera broke, so I picked this one up as a last minute replacement before a trip.  Got it based on price and reviews.  I like photos and taking them, but am not a photographer.  Looking to document adventures in my life more than do anything artistic.This camera is easy to use.  Was able to do everything I needed to do without reading the manual.  Plugged it in my computer (Mac) and iPhoto came up and did everything I needed it to do.  Easy as pie!  And I am not a technical person, by the way. :)What amazed me was the great color my photos has.  Really bright, really sharp.  Made me look like a much better photographer than I am.Good size.  Not the smallest, but comfortable to carry around with you, in a pocket or purse.  Display is large enough to tell what is going on, although it's good to have a bit of shade for easy reading.The last couple of cameras I have purchased have been Nikon.  After the great experience with this one, I am definitely getting a Fuji when this one goes out.  I expect that to be a few years from now though because it has all the features I need, it's small, and it is well constructed.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money, though battery drains quickly
Reviews.Author: John S. Harris "The Voice of Reason"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the money.  I have no problems with the features or performance.  My only complaint is that the battery life isn't as long as I'd like it to be.  Twice I've taken it to parties just to see the battery die within 3 hours or so.  I wish this was the kind of camera that operated on AAA batteries or other easily/cheaply replaceable batteries that I could carry as spares.  But other than that, I'm happy with the product.  The viewscreen is smaller than some other similar cameras, but the camera itself is pretty tiny too.  Even in its case it won't take up too much room in your pocket, which is good.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: N. L.
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 11 year old son for his birthday.  Everyone else in our home had a camera and he wanted one too.  For a little camera it takes pretty good pictures, comparable to cameras twice the price.  It does NOT take video, which he was at first a little disappointed about.  Overall he loves it.  The first two day he had it, he took over 300 pictures.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Sonia Lopez
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera with confidence due to the positive reviews I read on it.  I did however, return it because once in my hands I found that the LCD was much too small for me.  A good product though.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald S. Bryant "Ronald S. Bryant"
Reviews.Content: I like this camera.  I am not so good at taking pictures but this camera really works well for me.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: Jordon Cooper
Reviews.Content: It's not going to compare that well to a DSLR but compared to other cameras in it's class, it's an excellent little camera that I carry around with me all of the time.What I like about it is that it takes sharp clear photos (with my Kodak 433, I used to have to "sharpen" all of my photos) while with the Fuji, I find the photos look a lot better right off the card.There is some noise in lower light but that is normal for all of cameras in the class.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera
Reviews.Author: Cesar Polanco "Cesar"
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is one of the best cameras you can purchase here... Great Pictures, Great Resistance... Just Great

Reviews.Title: Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: J. V. Heyden
Reviews.Content: I love this camera....bought it for my mom for Christmas, takes great pictures, the screen is very clear...great snow pictures, which I couldn't get with my camera.....Not to many buttons on it so it is less confusing, but if you scroll through the menu this camera offers a lot.  Would definetly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: for the price, it's really nice
Reviews.Author: Andrea A. Smith "andreakorey"
Reviews.Content: My 12 yr old specifically picked this camera and he chose well. It is his second digital camera and he was looking to upgrade. It has many more features and settings than his last one. We all own fujifilm in this family because of its ability to produce true colors and take pretty darn good pictures in the auto mode and in lower lighting. We hardly ever use the flash and get really good pictures. It's small and lightweight too, and seems very durable. I would go with fujifilm brand always.

Reviews.Title: Simple, friendly, straight forward
Reviews.Author: E. Amir
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my father, a sixty years old who is far from being tech savvy. After ten minutes of practicing he's taking pictures like a pro (at least, a pro with an amateur camera!). We enjoyed the camera's simplicity, usefulness and big, bright screen so much, we bought one for ourselves. Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm Finepix J10 8.2MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Wilson "CSI Chosen 1"
Reviews.Content: Great camera that easy to use, take gorgeous pictures and is easy on the wallet. It's a little small, so if you have large hands, you may be a bit uncomfortable with it, but otherwise, it's great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Average
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my mother.  She really likes it and it is definitely a great, small, and portable device.  However, some of the menu options could be easier to navigate, and from what I have seen from other reviews, it is true that the corners of the pictures are darker; otherwise picture is good.  It comes with a rechargable battery, which is a plus.  Overall an average product.  Great for beginning and intermediate digital camera users.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: P. Dunlap
Reviews.Content: Good camera for first time digital camera users, color is vibrant! The video feature is great! I bought this camera for my daughter and she liked the compact feel of it.

Reviews.Title: A Gift Worth Giving
Reviews.Author: Rev Z "teacher61"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my 13 y/o son on his birthday.He said he read the instructions, maybe, but it was so easy to use he had mastered each feature in no time.

Reviews.Title: L.Griffin
Reviews.Author: Laura Griffin
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.It's simple to use and the pictures are really good.I'll be purchasing another for a gift soon. Very stylish and compact. I keep it with me wherever I go.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: A. Gusenkov "Alexander"
Reviews.Content: this is a good camera. thin and solid in body. simple and convenient in use. Menu is available in several languages. (I picked russian, so my family could use it too). Charger is available with the package.Good camera. buy it.

Reviews.Title: Finepix Camera
Reviews.Author: Ally
Reviews.Content: I received my camera quickly within a couple days, and I am overall happy with it. There's just basic settings so it's pretty easy to use and nothing complicated and a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: A. Echeverri
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!The features and menus are both easy to find and use.It is small and lightweight but it feels well-built and durable.I have tried the camera both indoors and outdoors with great results, it has  the auto function but if you try using the the settings you may obtain better results.I uploaded 3 pictures I took featuring my cat, and I must say I was amazed at the detail level obtained by the camera.If you are on a budget this is definitely a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great replacement
Reviews.Author: Marilyn S. "Reading mom"
Reviews.Content: My 4 yr old Finepix finally quit after thousands of pictures and hard use.  This is a very well priced replacement.

Reviews.Title: simple
Reviews.Author: SF 49ER "JOMO"
Reviews.Content: this was a replacement to the same model i dropped and broke(less than a month old).pretty simple to use and 8.2 mp is nice.other than a store having a big sale amazon has these cheaper than anyone.sign up for the prime club for the shipping then cancel within time.

Reviews.Title: it was a gift to my mom. She loves it.
Reviews.Author: Sergio L. Cariello
Reviews.Content: my brother got it first . He loved it.Then my mom wanted one too. She loves it.

Reviews.Title: Too slow
Reviews.Author: J. Grady "lusciousliterate"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my Canon Powershot A70, which I've had replaced or repaired at least 4 times over 5 years (now the lens is broken, again).  I got this one on a whim, because I wanted a more expensive one that wasn't in stock.  This camera is slow to take photos so many precious moments have been missed.  The way to change to another mode (movie, manual) is multi-step so again, moments are missed.  And it seems like photos aren't very bright.  I just bought another Canon.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: foothills
Reviews.Content: I bought three, one for mom one for dad and one for me.  I have a larger Nikon but wanted something more portable and easy to use.  I liked the Fuji, the controls are easy to use, it has enough functions to satisfy most useers and it's small enough to put easily in your pocket.Unfortunately, while sitting on a couch the camera dropped to the floor and the lens did not function after that.  The hardware holding the lens is plastic and the mechanism extending the lens got jammed up.It got sent back with minimal hassle, thanks Amazon!.  I will replace it with another slightly more expensive camera.Have not gotten a report from mom and dad yet, but I reviewed a lot of entry level cameras and this one looked great for older people looking for a digital camera that's easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Decent
Reviews.Author: cranberryfan
Reviews.Content: Low light pictures do not come out that well. Other than that I am pretty satisfied with the camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera great price
Reviews.Author: Carlos Aguirre
Reviews.Content: The reason I bought this camera was because of the price and let me tell you that it does a lot for it, pictures have great quality and the scene options are great, battery life is good and 8.2 resolution is more than you need. It also shots video at 640*480 and and lower res if you want.Comes with charger, battery, usb, composite cable and users manual.The works fine on vista and i dont know but i have a little issue on xp, when i try to import directly from picasa becuase they dont load but you can do it the old copy and paste way and youre done. Overall great camer highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: decent but one flaw
Reviews.Author: Charles E. Waltermyer
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer stated the audio in the movie mode is awful on this camera.  Other than that it is a decent camera for the money.  I am returning it for the poor audio as I'd like a camera that has everything work.  (if it means paying more).

Reviews.Title: short battery life
Reviews.Author: W. Dorman
Reviews.Content: Like this camera very much except for short battery life so far.  I am having problems with the lithium rechargible battery and Fuji wants me to send the whole camera in for service.  After fully charging the battery wont hold a charge for more than a week if not in use, and will only take about 15 pictures if used immediately.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!
Reviews.Author: John Bourhis
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th and worst digital camera I have owned. The pictures are not as sharp as other cameras I have owned, and the viewfinder was not completely accurate. The camera stopped working after only 3 months, and Fuji wanted to charge me for the repair. Possibly the worst purchase I have ever made. Just an awful camera from a terrible company (Fuji). Proceed with extreme caution.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera
Reviews.Author: Daniella
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for a few years and I have only had problems with it.The picture quality is horrible.  It is a task to get a picture that is not blurry if it doesn't have the flash on, which is very overpowering and makes everything dark behind the object in the picture.The battery life sucks.  It could be fully charged and when I turn it on to take some pictures it constantly shuts off because the battery is supposedly low.Before windows 7, you had to use the finepix program to get the pictures off the camera which was a pain.  Now it is easier thankfully.I would not buy this camera...it was a very big disappointment to me.

Reviews.Title: Very Bad
Reviews.Author: Meijer Goldstein
Reviews.Content: Horrible picture quality, comparable to the 20$ kiddy cams you get in toy stores. One picture may look OK, then the next is completely screwed up. Batteries are horrible and last maybe for 10 to 20 shots in just about any mode. Skip this POS and buy a Canon or Sony. Fuji needs to get out of the camera businnes.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect condition
Reviews.Author: K. Frizzell "K. Frizzell"
Reviews.Content: For the price I was very pleased to receive: the charger, a battery and a case included with the camera. Shipping was in a timely manner. The only problem was the colors and picture quality seemed to be less than perfect.I bought this camera because I owned the same camera and broke the screen. Since I already bought an extra battery for $30 I hated to just throw it all away with the broken camera. So with this purchase I ended up with 3 batteries, 2 chargers and a case to protect the screen from breaking again. But since I already owned this camera the picture quality was very noticeable to me.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, broke, company won't fix under warranty
Reviews.Author: Chris Bowers
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera recently and found it to be a wonderful camera.  Then the LCD looked like it had a crack in it even though we don't recall it EVER being dropped.  Fuji says they won't fix it under warranty.  They should have stood behind their product a little better rather than charging me $61 to fix the darn thing.

Reviews.Title: Small but neat camera
Reviews.Author: C. Brown "Lovely Ms. Brown"
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting this camera to be so small, but its smaller than my own phone. Its neat and pictures are okay for the price of the camera. It only holds THREE pictures without a sim card which I am upset about cause I didnt get a sim card right away. So best to purchase one with it or it would be a waste.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: K. Croskrey
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera just before going abroad on a trip and was very please with what I got. It's very simple and easy to use. I was a little disappointed that it doesn't seem to have a video recording feature, but it is a good point and shoot for a good price!

Reviews.Title: Great pics, horrible audio.
Reviews.Author: A. Torres "torres"
Reviews.Content: Just what the title says. Pictures looks great, but if you take a movie expect the audio to have an awfully loud static noise. I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Cheap.
Reviews.Author: Julian Velasco
Reviews.Content: I've purchased many cameras in the past few years, from subcompacts to DSLRs.  This is a very inexpensive camera and I wouldn't expect SLR-level performance, of course.  However, it is still disappointing.  In fairness, it is capable of taking perfectly nice pictures in ideal conditions.  But it is extremely inconsistent, and has poor low-light (i.e., indoors) performance.  Without optical image stabilization, its usefulness is extremely limited.  You can do better.

Reviews.Title: Good cheap camera - However, replacement battery $50!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: My wife teaches digital photography classes and has always used Fuji cameras (we have a collection of about 20). They are durable, are able to focus at 15 inches are so, and simple to use. The pictures are high quality when the price of the camera is considered.However, we CANNOT recommend this camera. Instead of the the typical pair of AA batteries, this camera uses a proprietary, non-standard battery. The price on Amazon is $49.95!When you are on vacation and use up the battery in one day, you won't be able to stick another pair in (unless of course you pay the $50.00).Many other point and shoots use AA batteries. We recommend you buy one of those instead.

Reviews.Title: Excelente por su precio
Reviews.Author: Cesar Lemus
Reviews.Content: La verdad que estoy conforme con la compra de esta cámara. Yo siempre he tenido Kodak y esta vez me decidi a cambiar. La calidad de la fotos son bastante aceptables, elimina los ojos rojos y en la oscuridad el flash logra el objetivo. El video tiene una calidad no muy buena pero hace el trabajo. La batería rinde mucho mas de lo que esperaba. Asi que por tan bajo precio las características generales de la cámara son muy buenas. Saludos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera....poor shipping
Reviews.Author: L. Washington "Picture Buff"
Reviews.Content: The camera is wonderful! It came out exactly as it looks on the website. I ordered it for my 11 year old daughter as a Christmas present and she loves it. She finds it very easy to use.My problem is with the shipping. I ordered it as a Christmas present after reading all the wonderful reviews regarding their shipping. It took the FULL 10 days to arrive at my house. It did not make it in time for Christmas. Then when it did arrive, the box was soaking wet all the way through!!! It seemed as though someone dropped it in the ocean and then delievered it to my door. Everything in the box was soaked! Luckily the important things were wrapped in plastic bags.With that said, I recommend the camera but allow plenty of time for delievery.

Reviews.Title: good camera but the anti blur is BS
Reviews.Author: Taylor Mohr
Reviews.Content: The reason i bought this camera is because it claimed to have "image stabilization." That is a bunch of bull. The anti-blur mode is even worse then the normal shooting mode. You cannot take pictures without a flash. You cannot take distance pictures without blur. Basically the only thing the camera can do is take up close pictures with a flash. I am returning it and am just going to re-purchase my original cannon i had that was only 7mp but took much much better pictures and videos....

Reviews.Title: worked for less than a month
Reviews.Author: D. B. Sweeney "dude"
Reviews.Content: Granted its not the most expensive feature packed camera,  picture quality not always that great.  about 1 in 4 pictures is waste due to image problems,  low light, blur etc.You MUST buy extra memory.  the internal memory will hold 2-3 pictures at the 8 MP setting.Oh, did I mention the LCD screen is cracked?  with minimal use, non abusive carried in my pocket the screen is unusable with no other view finder,  its unusable.  looking into warranty repair,  but I'm guessing it will cost more than the camera.if they repair under warranty,  I will give it 3 stars.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.2-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
3x optical zoom; 2.5-inch LCD
15 pre-programmed scene modes; Movie mode
Long-life rechargeable Li-ion battery
Stores images on xD or SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm Finepix J10 8.2MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom (Brushed Silver)
